decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The work to which this consent relates shall be begun not later than three years from the date of this consent. 
Reason: To comply with the requirements of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The works of demolition/alteration hereby authorised shall be carried out in complete accordance with the following plans and specifications:
1845 05 REVA; 1845 06 REVB; 1845 07 REVA; 1845 08 REVA; 1845 10 REVA; 1845 15 REVA;  1845 16 REVA; 1845 17;  1845 18 REVA; 1845 19 REVA; 1845 24; 1845/25; 5840 02 B; MJK.M-01A;  MJK.M-02A; MJK.M-03A; MJK.M-04A;   Plant Noise Impact Assessment (ref: SDV/EC16473-003);  RISK ASSESSMENT FOR ODOUR 01.05.19; Proposed Kitchen Extraction & Odour Control Statement 18/03/19; Material and Repair Schedule (ref: 1845) Appendix of Materials;  Level 3 Recording (ref 1845). 
Reason: To safeguard the character of the building, in accordance with Council policy DMS2 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016).
Condition : 3 - Details of the recommended mitigation measures in accordance with paragraph 7.06 of the Proposed Kitchen Extraction & Odour Control Statement 18/03/19 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the operation of the premises.  For the avoidance of doubt, the mitigation measures shall be implemented as a minimum prior to the operation of the premises.
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1c.  
Condition : 4 - Noise levels, (expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (10 minutes), from any new plant/machinery from the commercial use shall not exceed LA90-10dB at the boundary with the closest residential property. A post completion noise survey shall be conducted in order to verify compliance and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The operation of the mechanical equipment shall be maintained thereafter to comply with the agreed noise criteria.
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1c.  
Condition : 5 - The extraction and ventilation system hereby approved shall be installed and fully commissioned prior to the operation of the premises, thereafter the system shall be maintained as per manufacturers' instructions as a minimum.  
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1c.  
Condition : 6 - Prior to the operation of the public house, details of the odour control measures to be installed for the micro-brewery shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1c.  

Condition : 7 - The external ducting hereby approved shall be maintained in accordance with Risk Assessment for Odour dated 01/05/2019 and Proposed Kitchen Extraction & Odour Control Statement 18/03/19.  
To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD (2016) policy DMS1c.  
Condition : 8 - The van to be sited at first floor level shall be sited proud of the panelling and no ducts, pipes, cables or wiring should be pierced through the panelling.
Reason: To preserve the appearance of the Grade II listed building in accordance with DMPD (2016) policy DMS2.  
Condition : 9 - All replacement cornices and skirting boards shall match the existing in respect of their design and materiality. 
Reason: To ensure the proposed development preserves the Grade II listed building in accordance with DMPD policy DMS2.  
Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: Consideration should be given to the EMAQ document 'Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems' 2018 which is an update from the previous DEFRA document from 2005 which was withdrawn.
description: Internal alterations and refurbishment throughout including alterations to ground floor bar, installation of micro brewery, alterations to customer toilets, new commercial kitchen installation with new extraction system, new air conditioning system, reforming of original front entrance doors, removal of rear fire escape and alterations to layout of managers accommodation to additional staff bedrooms.
